query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Description of Business models in pilot projects and context analysis
result.description: Reports will be prepared with a description of the business models of the pilot projects which is based on the information collected through interviews with stakeholders. The aim of the reports is to give a general overview of the pilot projects and their business models. The report will be completed with the context analysis which describes the environment and the surrounding conditions in which the business model is operating. One report per pilot project and a general executive summary giving an overview of all the pilot projects will be prepared and published on the project website.

result.title: Web portal
result.description: The web portal will be the focal point of the WinWind dissemination activities. It will not only be designed and implemented to disseminate material, announce events and report results of WPs, but will also bring together the relevant stakeholders. The portal will have separate sections documenting activities and events of the regional/national desks.

result.title: Conceptual framework for analysing social acceptance barriers and drivers
result.description: The aim of this deliverable is to provide a common conceptual framework for analysing social acceptance drivers and barriers in the WinWind target regions. It also serves to derive indications about how to increase social acceptance, in terms of general, socio-political acceptance, market acceptance and community acceptance.

result.title: One national dissemination event per partner country
result.description: Each Member State participating in the project will host a national dissemination event that will bring together national stakeholders with an interest in grid connection of solar PV (including commercial development as well as community solar) to hear and discuss the findings of the project. These events will be completed by month 35 and a short report produced by each of the project partners and submitted with the final report as evidence of completion.

result.title: Integrating Energy Planning to Spatial & Socioeconomic Landscapes: A Roadmap for Take Up
result.description: This deliverable presents the overall synthesis of the work performed within INTENSSS-PA in order to assess the capacity and identify the required actions for the conceptual model of integrating energy planning into spatial planning and socio-economic landscape, to become a well tested structured decision making process ready to be integrated into policies and institutions of the Member States.

result.title: INTENSSS-PA Dissemination Plan & Communication Strategy (update 3)
result.description: The objective of this deliverable is to present the dissemination plan and identified dissemination strategies and the respective communication plan involving also and the scheduling of the dissemination and communication activities. It will be first issued on the month two (M2) of the project and it will be updated on M12, M18, M30, including developed and planned activities.

result.title: INTENSSS-PA Brochures (3)
result.description: As mentioned already (pls referred to 2.2) a brochure will be developed on the 13th month of the project (M13). This brochure will be available in English and in all consortium languages. On the 24th months (M24) a brochure on the national language of each region focused on the respective RLLs (i.e. seven different brochures) will be developed. This will form a meaningful dissemination tool for the exploitation and enhancement of the INTENSSS-PA concept beyond the completion of the project. For similar purposes a brochure on the overall project outcomes and results will be developed in English in order to act as a central dissemination material on final event and beyond the project duration on month 28th (M28).

result.title: INTENSSS-PA Brochures (1)
result.description: As mentioned already (pls referred to 2.2) a brochure will be developed on the 13th month of the project (M13). This brochure will be available in English and in all consortium languages. On the 24th months (M24) a brochure on the national language of each region focused on the respective RLLs (i.e. seven different brochures) will be developed. This will form a meaningful dissemination tool for the exploitation and enhancement of the INTENSSS-PA concept beyond the completion of the project. For similar purposes a brochure on the overall project outcomes and results will be developed in English in order to act as a central dissemination material on final event and beyond the project duration on month 28th (M28).

result.title: Analysis of the cost and performance development of the global and European CSP fleet
result.description: Based on the updated information and data of cost and performance development of all existing CSP stations and of all stations under construction, this report will present the results of from three analysis 1) the cost development of CSP, including learning rates for the different CSP technologies; 2) the performance of CSP stations, especially concerning their dispatchability; 3) the status and outlook of the European and global CSP industry, both in the developer and solar-specific components markets

result.title: Second consolidated summary report of desk activities in the target regions
result.description: The report highlights the findings of the second series of country thematic workshops. These provide non-biased information to stakeholders and market actors, critically assess best practice of socially acceptable solutions from exemplary wind energy developments, identify options to improve political/market/community acceptance in the target regions, and assess best practice transfer opportunities and restrictions. At least one of the thematic workshops will include a policy roundtable to address policy relevant proposals with politicians, policy makers and advisory organisations.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication plan
result.description: The plan will outline in detail which public and private target groups the project intends to reach, by means of which communication tools and through which dissemination channels. It will also identify and classify the communication and dissemination channels already used by the targeted stakeholder groups. A new version of the Dissemination and Communication Plan will be worked out for each year in order to: (i) plan the next dissemination and communication activities, (ii) refine the communication goals to be achieved according to the experience of the previous year and (iii) ensure the consistency of the communicated messages in relation to each other and in relation to the project's narrative
